Title: Physician Scientist, Translational Genetics, Target Discovery and Health Data mining
JD:
About the job
    


          We are looking for a talented Physician Scientist to join our Translational Human Genetics team. The position will be responsible for the translation of human genetic evidence into therapeutically-actionable insights. The post holder will work closely with other teams in the Regeneron Genetics Center and Regeneron at large. Primary responsibilities will be to design, contribute to the execution of and interpret large and complex human genetic studies. Goals of the team are to apply human genetics and the mining of health databases to therapeutic target discovery, therapeutic target validation, identification of biomarkers of target engagement, selection of indications for drug programs, and precision medicine applications.
Requirements
 MD with strong background in and profound knowledge of human genetics or genetic epidemiology. An outstanding candidate will be an MD/PhD with training and experience in translational human genetics, genetic epidemiology (or related disciplines) and strong quantitative skills. Demonstrated ability to design and lead human genetics studies delivering medically-relevant findings in a team-based environment. Ability to use medical knowledge to define relevant phenotypes for genetic association studies and to formulate innovative and important research questions. Familiarity with clinical genetics concepts and various genetic models of disease. Experience leading complex human genetics research endeavors. Knowledge of different study designs and analyses including GWAS, exome or genome sequencing in cohort, case-control or family-based studies. Ability to integrate different data resources to translate initial findings. An outstanding candidate will have experience with the use of genetics in combination with other “omics” technologies (eg. metabolomics, proteomics, RNA-seq). Familiarity with the applications of statistical genetics to gain medically-actionable insights including polygenic risk scores, quantitative traits analyses and Mendelian randomization. Familiarity with command line interface, programming languages and statistical software (eg. Python, R, STATA). Interest in understanding the genetic basis and causes of human diseases and translating this knowledge into therapeutic insights. An outstanding candidate will have previous experience with large-scale data mining for therapeutic target identification in specific therapeutic areas or across therapeutic areas. Ability to work in a highly interactive environment with a diverse team of colleagues and a commitment to promoting a collegial and highly inclusive working culture. Outstanding communication skills and an ability to summarize and present the results of human genetic studies to a variety of audiences. A commitment to high-quality science and to the highest standards of research and work ethics and integrity.
Responsibilities
 Work with a multidisciplinary genetics team consisting of human genetics scientists, bioinformaticians, statistical geneticists, other physician scientists and other team members to design, execute, and interpret genetics studies across therapeutic areas. Work in close collaboration with other Therapeutic Area Genetics team members and form a strong partnership with Genome Informatics, Analytical Genomics, Clinical Informatics and other RGC teams to deliver on complex, top-quality scientific endeavors. Generate, summarize, and present results in internal and external meetings to a variety of audiences. Lead or contribute to the writing of scientific reports and publications. Represent the Translational Genetics team in cross-functional initiatives within RGC and Regeneron. Collaborate with external industry and academic partners in scientific collaborations of strategic interest to the RGC.
Specific Responsibilities
 Plan and execute analyses aimed and identifying and validating targets using high-throughput agnostic genetic discovery approaches across therapeutic areas. Analyses will include genome- and exome-wide association analyses, meta-analyses, association analyses at specific loci including formal and approximate conditional analyses, generation of polygenic scores, estimation of heritability, penetrance, risk of disease-related complications, integration with external datasets and sources of data. Preparation of tables, figures, written reports and summary of results. Draft portions of scientific manuscripts, internal reports, patent applications.
Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! We have an inclusive and diverse culture that provides amazing benefits including health and wellness programs, fitness centers and stock for employees at all levels!

Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Associate Director, Development Data Science & Reporting at Regeneron
Title: Associate Director, Development Data Science & Reporting
JD:
About the job
    


          The Associate Director, Development Data Science Operational Data Steward will support Global Development’s data governance activities within the Operational domain including processes, policies and guidelines for administering the organization's data and records and ensure the Operational data processes are efficient and effective from end-to-end. The Associate Director Development Data Science Operational Data Steward ensures compliance to data standards and data curation policies and processes in partnership with Functional Areas. The Associate Director Development Data Science Operational Data Steward is responsible for coordinating the management of Global Development’s Master Data and ontologies and serves as a point of contact for governance, data quality and protection issues.
Drive consistency of operational data governance strategy across Global Development Functional AreasSupport the design, definition and delivery of operational data exchange between Regeneron and its strategic partners e.g. CROsSupport and maintain a Global Development-wide federated data governance framework with business objective of ensuring quality of data.Support the methodologies to define ontologies and taxonomies for information management at the Functional area level and curate at the Global Development levelCapture and document metadata and ontologies for Global Development data and records.Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards and data protection standards, processes and procedures cross functionally and within individual functional areas.Develop & maintain Global Development data maps including authoritative systems and ownersCreate automated, scalable approaches for data quality issue identification and mitigation within the Operational domainPartner with members of Global Development, other Regeneron Departments and external third parties, to continuously validate and improve the quality of internal and external dataEngage with the industry to learn about best practices for data governance and support the introduction of new innovative capabilities to the business.Develop and analyze metrics for adoption and compliance with operational governance processes.Ensure alignment to security and privacy requirements/standards
Requirements
BS/BA Degree and/or 8+/10 years relevant experience. MS degree and 5+ years relevant experience.
Functional area expertise preferred. Ideal candidate comes from a business function background (e.g. Development Operations, Data Management, Regulatory).
Strong knowledge of industry data standards e.g. CDISC.Familiar with DMBoK, DAMA and other governance field standardsExperience defining and document metadata and ontologiesGood problem solving, technical writing and verbal communication skillsAdept at the use of structured and unstructured data sources, including image-based data, device data, and real-world dataProblem solving, analytical, quality approach and Strong eye for businessAbility to effectively manage multiple priorities with a sense of urgencyStrong track record of project management, partner management, budget management and collaboration skills

Title: Summer 2023 Intern- MS/PhD Industrial & Organizational Psychology, Statistics, Data Science or Related Majors
JD:
About the job
    


          If you’re a student pursuing a Masters or PhD in Industrial & Organizational Psychology, Statistics, or related majors, you may be a fit for an internship in our Talent Development department within HR.
This Student's Work May Include
 Consulting with different business units to support the development of employee surveys Helping with survey design, administration and follow up Designing compelling results to provide insights to business leaders and assist with creating a broader insight report on the full employee experience (from candidate to new hire to full time employee) Providing support with implementing action-planning based on employee survey results
Please apply to one Internship of interest that best matches your major.
In this role, a typical summer might include the following: 
Achieving a general understanding of what happens in our global organizationCompleting hands-on project work that has an impact on the businessEngaging with Regeneron leadershipCollaborating with a specific hiring manager and other internsEstablishing connections with Regeneron’s diverse set of employee resource groupsParticipating in professional development sessions while enjoying lots of free food and swagShowcasing the knowledge you gained through end of program presentation sessionsGetting paid for your hard work!
This Role Might Be For You If
You want to make a differenceYou advocate for your ideas – and what they can do in the worldYou’re excited to think, challenge, listen, re-think and solveYou continuously look for ways to improveYou are science-minded, ask questions and challenge conventional wisdomYou work with precision, passion, thoughtfulness and integrityYou’re ready to work with the team that can bring a great idea to lifeYou know this is no ordinary job
To be considered for this opportunity, you must be enrolled in, or accepted to, an academic program pursuing a Graduate degree (and be returning to school the semester following the internship). A cumulative GPA of 3.0 is preferred. We want someone who is able to commit to 40 hours per week for a minimum of 10 weeks from the end of May/ early June through August. Demonstrated leadership in areas such as campus activities, clubs, sports, current or previous work, or within the community is also preferred.
